text: I'd have to say having walked around it
for the year that I love nearly every

just enough without it being too

beautiful balance
Newport Street is a long-term idea of
Damien Hirst's he's built a collection
over the last 15 years and the purchase
of the building allowed him the
possibility to create this wonderful
space well Damien Hirst was very closely
involved and from an architect's point
of view he was the dream client he's a
nice person but he's also very demanding
and really passionate about making
spaces that are good for art they were
amazing buildings from 1912 that were
used to build scenery in West End
theatres there were three buildings and
they're very special because they're
enormous single interiors very tall with
rather distinctive facades in brick and
the design was about really trying to
add to what we thought was special about
these buildings doing a new building at
one end with the entrance and galleries
and another building at the other end
with offices for the organization the
first show was a very simple painting
show and it was a the opportunity to sue
to place a painting on that wall and it
and it managed it really well now we
have the jeff koons show so you know
it's actually very versatile you can see

here in order to make two large

here that connects this level in this
level and in the center there's this
very tall gallery
from in this gallery you're going up
eight meters to get to the upper floor
it's a long way to go so we tried to
make the staircases something of an
event
my favorite part I suppose at the

you don't encounter these or harsh
